conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows extruded walls with visible thickness and an elevated/angled cutaway view exposing interior spaces; multiple wall faces (top/side) are visible.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; cutaway is clean. View is slightly close to top-down but still distinctly 3D with visible vertical faces.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (living/dining left-center, kitchen/utility bottom-left, bedrooms cluster right, servant room bottom-left, toilets in similar bands). Some partitions around the master suite (dress/toilet segmentation) are not as clearly faithful, and several opening locations/sizes are hard to confirm.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (sofas, dining table, beds) with reasonable scale; kitchen counters and bathroom fixtures are shown and generally placed in the correct zones.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with consistent materials and clean background. However, door swings/windows are not clearly depicted, reducing structural legibility for openings.

detected_errors.description: Master suite sub-layout (dress area vs. attached toilets) is not clearly or fully separated as in the 2D plan, suggesting partition simplification or distortion.
Door/window placement and proportional opening sizes cannot be verified well; several openings appear simplified or omitted.
Camera is near top-down, reducing perceived depth compared to a stronger isometric view.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with largely faithful overall layout, but with some partition/opening fidelity loss (notably around the master suite and door/window detailing).
